metadata.title: CVE-2024-36946 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: phonet:fix rtm_phonet_notify() skb allocation fill_route() stores three componentsin the skb: - struct rtmsg - RTA_DST (u8) - RTA_OIF (u32) Therefore,rtm_phonet_notify() should use NLMSG_ALIGN(sizeof(struct rtmsg)) +nla_total_size(1) + nla_total_size(4)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-36946` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-232-generic - 4.15.0-232.244
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-232-generic - 4.15.0-232.244
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-232-lowlatency - 4.15.0-232.244
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-192-generic - 5.4.0-192.212~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-192-lowlatency - 5.4.0-192.212~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-232.244').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-192.212~18.04.1').

linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1176.189').
